transcript:
guns and wagons themselves. Whips cracked, hoofs slipped, traces broke, and lungs were strained with shouting. The offi- cers directing the march rode backward and forward between the carts. Their voices were but feebly heard amid the uproar and one saw by their faces that they despaired of the possi- bility of checking this disorder. 
"Here is our dear Orthodox Russian army,"
